paragraphs.text: Where's the attention from Sharpton & Jackson for Black lives in St  Louis beating?
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: The shooting death of Michael Brown, an unarmed black teenager, by a white policeman rightly set off alarms
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But much less media attention -- especially from the black civil rights leadership -- has gone to the deadly assault on a white man by three black teenage boys in St  Louis
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which is likely to end with adult murder convictions and life sentences for the boys
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That sentence equals a long, slow death in jail just as final and awful as Michael Brown's fate
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: St  Louis police and politicians say there was nothing racial about the attack on Zemir Begic, 32, a Bosnian immigrant
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: They say it was not a hate crime aimed at Bosnians
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: And they say it had nothing to do with the racial crisis in Ferguson over Brown's death
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Yes, it did
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Black men have the highest rate of conviction for violent crime of any racial group in the country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The harsh truth is that we're really talking about poor, young Black men
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In any case, Blacks have the highest dropout and unemployment rates
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Black children have the highest poverty rate of any group of children
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Poor black boys too often take their fashion and cultural cues from rap music that celebrates criminal behavior as a show of power and rebellion
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Often, the result is a thuggish attitude, including dressing like convicts with their pants falling down because the jail guards have taken away their belts
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Another consequence of civil rights leaders' failure to challenge criminal behavior in black neighborhoods is the angry, defiant interactions between those black teenagers and the police
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Once the black violence leads to death, especially if it is beyond the streets of a poor black neighborhood, there is no mercy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The broken justice system that gives police a pass for killing an unarmed black teen is hard evidence that Americans, middle-class blacks and whites, think classifying young black men as an ongoing threat to public safety is not racial stereotyping
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And the police and grand jurors see physically large black men -- in the cases of both Michael Brown and New York's Eric Garner, who was choked to death by police-- as especially threatening
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: How else do you explain the lack of human compassion by the police for Garner as he complained,"I can't breathe"?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: How else do you understand two grand juries deciding there is nothing wrong with two people being killed by the police, agents of the government, if the value of their lives is equal to every other citizen's life?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In Garner's case, the police were videotaped choking him even though he never fought with them
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: And the grand jurors still refused to allow the police to go on trial
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Mandatory body cameras for police are a good idea
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they are not a panacea for the troubled relationship between the larger society and the broken black families, the poorly educated black children and the steady violence in poor black American communities
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Recall that Garner's death at the hands of the police is on videotape
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it made no difference in the grand jury's decision not to indict the police
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Even with the video, what the prosecutor and the grand jurors saw in Garner was not a fellow citizen being hurt, but a troubling social reality
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They saw a potential threat to themselves in a big black man hustling on the street
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: even if this was a middle-aged man with no violent intent who was violating only a minor law by selling loose cigarettes
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Garner and Brown are in their graves
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the body count continues as poor black teenagers, especially boys, march from single-parent homes to bad schools, to jails and to wasted lives
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It begins with acting out in defiance of a larger society that ignores them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sometimes there are displays of anger that are seen as threatening
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Other times there are confrontations with the police that end with the boys in jail or the grave
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Robert Joseph Mitchell, the 17-year-old charged with first-degree murder in the attack on Begic, looks to fit in that group of poor, young black men in the "pipeline" to prison
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Also in the "pipeline" to wasted lives are two other black boys, 15 and 16
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: whom police arrested after the murder
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: And don't forget Begic, an innocent man having fun with his fiancee who lost his life because he crossed paths with these furious black boys
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: This is the deeper social breakdown born of segregation of poor black people, lack of opportunity and too many people living with acceptance of anger at the poor for making the larger society so uncomfortable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: so fearful
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The protests over the Brown and Garner cases deserve to be celebrated in the American tradition of social movements against injustice
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But where are the protests over the drive-by shootings of black thugs by other black thugs?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Where are the protests against the bad schools that close the door of economic opportunity on poor children, disproportionately poor children of color?
paragraphs.label: assumption
